description.narrative:
1. Number and percentage of new smear-positive TB patients successfully treated (cured plus completed treatment) among the new smear positive TB patients registered
2. Number of new smear-positive TB cases detected
3. Number of health facilities with at least one health worker trained on TB
4. Percentage of all forms of TB patients successfully treated (cured plus completed treatment) among the new all TB forms patients registered
5. Number of new TB cases detected (all forms)
6. Number of TB suspects amongst refugees who are screened for TB according to national policy
7. Number of contacts of smear-positive TB patients screened for TB according to national policy

9. Number and percentage of districts submitting timely and complete quarterly reports on notification and treatment outcome according to the national guidelines
10. Proportion of TB units reporting no stock-out of first-line anti-TB drugs for more than a week in the last reporting quarter
11. Number and percentage of laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance for smear microscopy among the total number of laboratories that undertake smear microscopy during the reporting period

comment.narrative: 1. 8,706 students enrolled in Awqaf schools 2. The dropout rate reached 13% last September2012, where according to the studies, 10% of Palestinian children in the 8thor9thgrade school age were not enrolled in any educational institution. For 10thgraders, this figure doubled to 20% and by 11thgrade, 30% of the students did not attend school. The cumulative dropout rate resulted in 36% of children in East Jerusalem failing to complete a full 12 years of school 3. 31 schools managed by JDoE 4. 512 classrooms available in Awqaf Schools

Health - policy, planning and administration

This project aims to promote knowledge and awareness in Human Development in oPt. It is part of a multi-phased programme designed for advocacy in oPt as per UNDP's contribution to setting the development agenda and supporting development debate.

The NHDR project will be implemented in three tracks. It involves the preparation of the NHDR itself, cover the carrying out of the quarterly surveys on perceptions and the production of Human Development materials and programme development support.

title.narrative: Palestinian National Unity and Social Cohesion Programme

description.narrative: The project aims to strengthen Palestinian National Unity by addressing issues pertaining to national reconciliation, civil service reintegration, improving local capacities and planning schemes, as well as the social cohesion of Palestinian society.

The project aims at anchoring national unity and social cohesion throughout the Palestinian society through support to consolidated governance mechanisms, social reconciliation, & enhanced civic engagement.

title.narrative: Rehabilitation & Construction of Gaza Industrial Estate

description.narrative: Promoting inclusive, sustainable, private sector-led economic development and therefore promoting decent-job creation in the Gaza Strip, building the path towards a green economy
